responsibilities: Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key decisions and process improvements.
Work closely with the Marketing teams in areas including Performance Marketing, Brand Marketing, Healthcare, and CRM to provide online reporting and analysis using business intelligence tools.
Gather business and functional requirements and translate these requirements into robust, scalable, operable solutions.
Produce comprehensive, usable data set documentation, metadata, BI reports, Dashboards, and insights.
Collaborate with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and various technological platforms.
Recognize and embrace best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Respond to high-priority requests from senior business leaders.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for secondary data sets.
skills: Advanced knowledge of SQL and data modeling.
Intermediate knowledge in Python and advanced data visualization tools such as Plotly/Dash/React/D3Js.
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and communicate them to collaborators and senior management.
Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles.
Ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
qualifications: BA/BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience building automated data warehousing environments for production reports or tables.
Familiarity with Redshift, Snowflake DWH, and S3 or similar data lakes preferred.
3+ years’ experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Quicksight, or similar (familiarity with Tableau preferred).
3+ years of experience with data modeling in large Data warehousing, data lake environment.
Be dedicated and show the ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or ‘dirty’ data.
